casebody.data:
GREEN POND CORPORATION AND GREEN POND MOUNTAIN CORPORATION, PLAINTIFFS-APPELLANTS, v. TOWNSHIP OF ROCKAWAY AND JEFFERSON TOWNSHIP, DEFENDANTS-RESPONDENTS. Superior Court of New Jersey Appellate Division Argued April 5, 1982 Decided April 29, 1982.

*535Before Judges MILMED, JOELSON and GAULKIN.

George J. Gotz argued the cause for appellants (Weber, Muth & Weber, attorneys; George J. Cotz, on the initial and reply briefs). Robert Goldsmith argued the cause for respondent Township of Rockaway (Wiley, Malehorn & Sirota, attorneys; Frederic J. Sirota, of counsel; Robert Goldsmith, on the brief). Kenihan, Cohen & Kron, attorneys for respondent Township of Jefferson (Lawrence P. Cohen, on the brief). PER CURIAM.,

Appellants and respondent Township of Jefferson having agreed to a dismissal of the appeal in this matter from so much of the judgment under review as pertains to said Township, and a stipulation to that effect having been filed with the Clerk of this court, that part of the appeal is dismissed, with prejudice.

The remainder of the judgment under review is < ffirmed substantially for the reasons expressed by Judge Andrew in his opinion for the Tax Court of February 26, 1981. 2 N.J.Tax 273.
